dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey, Host_B, did you see the latest from the House Oversight Committee? Quite a bit of spending by the Pentagon at, uh, Trump's Scottish resort.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey, Host B, did you see the latest from the House Oversight Committee? Quite a bit of spending by the Pentagon at, uh, Trump's Scottish resort.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Pentagon has spent at least $184,000if not moreat President Trumps Scottish resort since he took office, according to documents released by the House Oversight Committee on Wednesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, I sure did, Host_A. We're talking at least $184,000 spent *since* he left office. Pretty significant, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, I sure did, Host A. We're talking at least one hundred eighty four thousand dollars spent since he left office. Pretty significant, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Pentagon has spent at least $184,000if not moreat President Trumps Scottish resort since he took office, according to documents released by the House Oversight Committee on Wednesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, for sure. And it's at Trump Turnberry, his place. Like, how did this all come to light, exactly?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, for sure. And it's at Trump Turnberry, his place. Like, how did this all come to light, exactly?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Defense Department records show that nearly $125,000 was spent at the Trump Turnberry resort in Scotland since August 2017.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it kinda spiraled from an inquiry back in June. They were looking into a surge of Air Force flights stopping at Glasgow Prestwick Airport.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it kinda spiraled from an inquiry back in June. They were looking into a surge of Air Force flights stopping at Glasgow Prestwick Airport.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The House Oversight and Reform Committee had originally asked in June about a surge in Air Force flights stopping at Glasgow Prestwick Airport in Scotland.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. And then the crews, like, didn't stay at the airport? They were put up 30 miles away at Turnberry?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. And then the crews, like, didn't stay at the airport? They were put up thirty miles away at Turnberry?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Various crews have been put up 30 miles away, at Trump Turnberry, during overnight stopovers, Politico first reported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Many of them, uh, stayed overnight during stopovers. The Defense Department records show nearly $125,000 spent there since August 2017.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Many of them, uh, stayed overnight during stopovers. The Defense Department records show nearly one hundred twenty five thousand dollars spent there since August twenty seventeen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Defense Department records show that nearly $125,000 was spent at the Trump Turnberry resort in Scotland since August 2017.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So, like, at $189 a night, that's a lot of individual room stays, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So, like, at one hundred eighty nine dollars a night, that's a lot of individual room stays, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At an average cost of $189 per night, that would suggest a total of 660 individual rooms paid for.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, over 660 rooms paid for. Plus, there was another $60,000 spent tied to travel vouchers, and that wasn't even for meals or restaurants.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, over six hundred sixty rooms paid for. Plus, there was another sixty thousand dollars spent tied to travel vouchers, and that wasn't even for meals or restaurants.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: There was also about $60,000 spent at the resort that could not be tied to actual travel vouchers, with the Pentagons letter suggesting that it could have been used on meals and restaurants.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Huh. So the committee is still probing all this, trying to figure out if Trump was, you know, completely financially self-sufficient after leaving office.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh. So the committee is still probing all this, trying to figure out if Trump was, you know, completely financially self-sufficient after leaving office.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The spending figure was disclosed in a letter sent to congressional investigators, who are probing whether Trump violated a constitutional provision prohibiting presidents from enriching themselves through the office.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's the gist of it. This spending came out in a letter to those congressional investigators.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's the gist of it. This spending came out in a letter to those congressional investigators.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The spending figure was disclosed in a letter sent to congressional investigators, who are probing whether Trump violated a constitutional provision prohibiting presidents from enriching themselves through the office.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I remember some arguments that, like, Trump wasn't profiting from office or that spending at his properties decreased after he left. This kinda clashes with that, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I remember some arguments that, like, Trump wasn't profiting from office or that spending at his properties decreased after he left. This kinda clashes with that, doesn't it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It definitely complicates that narrative. I mean, the Democratic House Oversight Committee *did* say they were satisfied with the details the Pentagon provided...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It definitely complicates that narrative. I mean, the Democratic House Oversight Committee did say they were satisfied with the details the Pentagon provided...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While leaders of the Democratic House Oversight Committee voiced frustration with the limited details in the Pentagons response, it still reveals that far more taxpayer funds have been spent at the Presidents resort than previously known, they wrote back to the Pentagon on Wednesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] But they also said it, uh, showed "no impact," right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But they also said it, uh, showed no impact, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While leaders of the Democratic House Oversight Committee voiced frustration with the limited details in the Pentagons response, it still reveals that far more taxpayer funds have been spent at the Presidents resort than previously known, they wrote back to the Pentagon on Wednesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Precisely. Meaning, despite the extensive details, it didn't really resolve their core questions or concerns about whether he was profiting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Precisely. Meaning, despite the extensive details, it didn't really resolve their core questions or concerns about whether he was profiting.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So they got the info, but it didn't clear the air, so to speak.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So they got the info, but it didn't clear the air, so to speak.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Not at all. And while the article *did* mention the D.C. hotel wasn't a 'hotspot' for lobbyists, other reports, like from CREW, suggest a lot of activity at other Trump properties.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Not at all. And while the article did mention the D C hotel wasn't a hotspot for lobbyists, other reports, like from C R E W, suggest a lot of activity at other Trump properties.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Trump hotel in Washington D.C., for instance, has become a hotspot for various lobbyists and political figures hoping to garner favor with the president.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, like hundreds of members of Congress, administration officials, and, uh, foreign dignitaries from dozens of countries?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, like hundreds of members of Congress, administration officials, and, uh, foreign dignitaries from dozens of countries?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the last two years alone, at least 90 members of Congress, 250 administration officials and over 110 foreign officials from nearly 60 different countries have been seen at different Trump properties, according to a count by Citizens for Responsibility and Ethics in Washington.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Yeah, exactly. So the scrutiny, Host_A, is definitely far from over.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly. So the scrutiny, Host A, is definitely far from over.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. It just goes to show, like, how tangled these things can get.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. It just goes to show, like, how tangled these things can get.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Always a lot to unpack when it comes to these intersections of public service and private business interests.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Always a lot to unpack when it comes to these intersections of public service and private business interests.
